locked.description: whether this map is considered locked down

map_id.description: map where the device belongs to

orientation.description: orientation, 0-359, in degrees, up is 0, right is 90.

poe_passthrough.description: whether to enable power out through module port (for APH) or eth1 (for APL/BT11)

port_config.description:
eth0 is allowed in mesh relay mode, otherwise eth0 is not allowed here. 
The property key is the interface(s) name (e.g. "eth1" or"eth1,eth2")

base.description: additional power to request during negotiating with PSE over PoE, in mW

prefer_usb_over_wifi.description: whether to enable power out to peripheral, meanwhile will reduce power to wifi (only for AP45 at power mode)

dot1x.description: Whether to do 802.1x against uplink switch. When enaled, AP cert will be used to do EAP-TLS and the Org's CA Cert has to be provisioned at the switch

vars.description: a dictionary of name->value, the vars can then be used in Wlans. This can overwrite those from Site Vars

host.description: required if enabled, aeroscout server host

locate_connected.description: whether to enable the feature to allow wireless clients data received and sent to AES server for location calculation

beam_disabled.description: list of AP BLE location beam numbers (1-8) which should be disabled at the AP and not transmit location information (where beam 1 is oriented at the top the AP, growing counter-clock-wise, with 9 being the omni BLE beam)

eddystone_uid_adv_power.description: advertised TX Power, -100 to 20 (dBm), omit this attribute to use default

eddystone_uid_enabled.description: only if `beacon_enabled`==`false`, Whether Eddystone-UID beacon is enabled

eddystone_uid_freq_msec.description: Frequency (msec) of data emmit by Eddystone-UID beacon

eddystone_url_adv_power.description: advertised TX Power, -100 to 20 (dBm), omit this attribute to use default

eddystone_url_enabled.description: only if `beacon_enabled`==`false`, Whether Eddystone-URL beacon is enabled

eddystone_url_freq_msec.description: Frequency (msec) of data emmit by Eddystone-UID beacon

ibeacon_adv_power.description: advertised TX Power, -100 to 20 (dBm), omit this attribute to use default

ibeacon_enabled.description: can be enabled if `beacon_enabled`==`true`, whether to send iBeacon

ibeacon_freq_msec.description: Frequency (msec) of data emmit for iBeacon

ibeacon_uuid.description: optional, if not specified, the same UUID as the beacon will be used

enabled.description:
when acted as client bridge:
* only 5G radio can be used
* will not serve as AP on any radios

output.description: whether the pin is configured as an output. DO and A1-A4 can be repurposed by changing

pullup.description: the type of pull-up the pin uses (internal, external, none), default none
the type of pull-up the pin uses (internal, external, none), default none

enabled.description: whether mesh is enabled on this AP

group.description: mesh group, base AP(s) will only allow remote AP(s) in the same mesh group to join, 1-9, optional

additional_vlan_ids.description: additional VLAN IDs, only valid in mesh base mode

mxtunnel_name.description: if `forwarding`==`site_mxedge`, vlan_ids comes from site_mxedge (`mxtunnels` under site setting)

vlan_id.description:
optional to specify the vlan id for a tunnel if forwarding is for `wxtunnel`, `mxtunnel` or `site_mxedge`.
* if vlan_id is not specified then it will use first one in vlan_ids[] of the mxtunnel.
* if forwarding == site_mxedge, vlan_ids comes from site_mxedge (`mxtunnels` under site setting)

wxtunnel_id.description: if `forwarding`==`wxtunnel`, the port is bridged to the vlan of the session

wxtunnel_remote_id.description: if `forwarding`==`wxtunnel`, the port is bridged to the vlan of the session

acct_interim_interval.description: how frequently should interim accounting be reported, 60-65535. default is 0 (use one specified in Access-Accept request from RADIUS Server). Very frequent messages can affect the performance of the radius server, 600 and up is recommended when enabled

network.description:
use `network`or `source_ip`
which network the RADIUS server resides, if there's static IP for this network, we'd use it as source-ip

mxcluster_ids.description:
To use Org mxedges when this WLAN does not use mxtunnel, specify their mxcluster_ids.
Org mxedge(s) identified by mxcluster_ids

server_name.description: name of the server to verify (against the cacerts in Org Setting). Only if not Mist Edge.

servers.description: List of Radsec Servers. Only if not Mist Edge.

use_site_mxedge.description: To use Site mxedges when this WLAN does not use mxtunnel

ant_gain_24.description: antenna gain for 2.4G - for models with external antenna only

ant_gain_5.description: antenna gain for 5G - for models with external antenna only

ant_gain_6.description: antenna gain for 6G - for models with external antenna only

band_24_usage.description: if `band_24_usage`==`5`, by default, band_5 properties is used, if specific channel/bandwidth/power/... is desired, use the "band_5_on_24_radio"

bandwidth.description: channel width for the band, 20 / 40 / 80 / 160, 80 is only applicable for band_5 and 160 is only for band_6, ignored if channel is 0

channel.description: For Device. (primary) channel for the band, 0 means using the Site Setting

channels.description: For RFTemplates. List of channels, null or empty array means auto

power.description: TX power of the radio. For Devices, 0 mean using the Site Setting

power_max.description: when power=0, max tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set

power_min.description: when power=0, min tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set

channel.description:
only if `type`==`imagotag`
channel selection, not needed by default, required for manual channel override only

enabled.description: whether to enable any usb config

imagotag_type.description:
only if `type`==`imagotag`
if native imagotag is enabled, BLE will be disabled automatically

verify_cert.description: only if `type`==`imagotag`, whether to turn on SSL verification

device_switch.description:
Switch Configuration
You can configure `port_usages` and `networks` settings at the device level, but most of the time it's better use the Site Setting to achieve better consistency and be able to re-use the same settings across switches entries defined here will "replace" those defined in Site Setting/Network Template

acl_tags.description: ACL Tags to identify traffic source or destination. Key name is the tag name

disable_auto_config.description: for a claimed switch, we control the configs by default. This option (disables the behavior)

dns_servers.description: Global dns settings. To keep compatibility, dns settings in `ip_config` and `oob_ip_config` will overwrite this setting

dns_suffix.description: Global dns settings. To keep compatibility, dns settings in `ip_config` and `oob_ip_config` will overwrite this setting

extra_routes.description: The property key is the network name or a CIDR

managed.description: for an adopted switch, we dont overwrite their existing configs automatically

ntp_servers.description: list of NTP servers specific to this device. By default, those in Site Settings will be used

other_ip_configs.description: The property key is the network name

port_config.description: The property key is the port name or range (e.g. "ge-0/0/0-10")

port_usages.description: The property key is the port profile name

protect_re.description:
restrict inbound-traffic to host
when enabled, all traffic that is not essential to our operation will be dropped 
e.g. ntp / dns / traffic to mist will be allowed by default, if dhcpd is enabled, we'll make sure it works

trusted_hosts.description: optionally, host/subnets we'll allow traffic to/from

vars.description: a dictionary of name->value, the vars can then be used in Wlans. This can overwrite those from Site Vars

mac.description: fpc0, same as the mac of device_id

vc_role.description: Both vc_role master and backup will be matched to routing-engine role in Junos preprovisioned VC config

preprovisioned.description: to configure whether the VC is preprovisioned or nonprovisioned

junos_acl_policies.description:
- for GBP-based policy, all src_tags and dst_tags have to be gbp-based
- for ACL-based policy, `network` is required in either the source or destination so that we know where to attach the policy to

allow_dst_tags.description:
- for GBP-based policy, all src_tags and dst_tags have to be gbp-based
- for ACL-based policy, `network` is required in either the source or destination so that we know where to attach the policy to

deny_dst_tags.description:
- for GBP-based policy, all src_tags and dst_tags have to be gbp-based
- for ACL-based policy, `network` is required in either the source or destination so that we know where to attach the policy to

gbp_tag.description:
required if
- `type`==`dynamic_gbp` (gbp_tag received from RADIUS)
- `type`==`static_gbp` (applying gbp tag against matching conditions)

macs.description:
required if 
- `type`==`mac`
- `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching mac

network.description:
if:
- `type`==`mac` (optional. default is `any`)
- `type`==`subnet` (optional. default is `any`)
- `type`==`network`
- `type`==`resource` (optional. default is `any`)
- `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching network (vlan)

radius_group.description:
required if 
- `type`==`radius_group` 
- `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching radius_group

specs.description:
if `type`==`resource`
empty means unrestricted, i.e. any

subnets.description:
if 
- `type`==`subnet` 
- `type`==`resource` (optional. default is `any`)
- `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching subnet

dns_servers.description: if `type`==`local` - optional, if not defined, system one will be used

dns_suffix.description: if `type`==`local` - optional, if not defined, system one will be used

fixed_bindings.description: The property key is the MAC Address

gateway.description: if `type`==`local` - optional, `ip` will be used if not provided

options.description: Property key is the DHCP option number

vendor_encapulated.description:
Property key is <enterprise number>:<sub option code>, with
* enterprise number: 1-65535  (https://www.iana.org/assignments/enterprise-numbers/enterprise-numbers)
* sub option code: 1-255, sub-option code

junos_dhcpd.description: if DHCP Server/Relay is intended. The property key is the network name

enable_arp_spoof_check.description: Enable for dynamic ARP inspection check

enable_ip_source_guard.description: Enable for check for forging source IP address

networks.description: if `all_networks`==`false`, list of network with DHCP snooping enabled

netmask.description: used only if `subnet` is not specified in `networks`

network.description: the network where this mgmt IP reside, this will be used as default network for outbound-ssh, dns, ntp, dns, tacplus, radius, syslog, snmp

junos_networks.description: A network represents a network segment. It can either represent a VLAN (then usually ties to a L3 subnet), optionally associate it with a subnet which can later be used to create addition routes. Used for ports doing `family ethernet-switching`. It can also be a pure L3-subnet that can then be used against a port that with `family inet`.

subnet.description: optional for pure switching, required when L3 / routing features are used

additionalProperties.description:
- If HA configuration: key parameter will be nodeX (eg: node1)
- If there are 2 routing engines, re1 mgmt IP has to be set separately (if desired): key parameter = `re1`

netmask.description: used only if `subnet` is not specified in `networks`

network.description: optional, the network to be used for mgmt

netmask.description: used only if `subnet` is not specified in `networks`

network.description: optional, the network to be used for mgmt

node1.description: for HA Cluster, node1 can have different IP Config

netmask.description: used only if `subnet` is not specified in `networks`

network.description: optional, the network to be used for mgmt

use_mgmt_vrf.description: if supported on the platform. If enabled, DNS will be using this routing-instance, too

use_mgmt_vrf_for_host_out.description: whether to use `mgmt_junos` for host-out traffic (NTP/TACPLUS/RADIUS/SYSLOG/SNMP), if alternative service is desired

use_mgmt_vrf.description: if supported on the platform. If enabled, DNS will be using this routing-instance, too

use_mgmt_vrf_for_host_out.description: whether to use `mgmt_junos` for host-out traffic (NTP/TACPLUS/RADIUS/SYSLOG/SNMP), if alternative service is desired

no_summary.description: for a stub/nssa area, where to avoid forwarding type-3 LSA to this area

areas.description: OSPF areas to run on this device and the corresponding per-area-specific configs. The property key is the area

enabled.description: whether to rung OSPF on this device

junos_other_ip_configs.description: optional, if it's required to have switch's L3 presense on a network/vlan

evpn_anycast.description: for EVPN, if anycast is desired

netmask.description: optional, `subnet` from `network` definition will be used if defined

ae_disable_lacp.description: To disable LACP support for the AE interface

ae_idx.description: Users could force to use the designated AE name

critical.description: if want to generate port up/down alarm

disable_autoneg.description: if `speed` and `duplex` are specified, whether to disable autonegotiation

dynamic_usage.description: Enable dynamic usage for this port. Set to `dynamic` to enable.

mtu.description: media maximum transmission unit (MTU) is the largest data unit that can be forwarded without fragmentation

no_local_overwrite.description: prevent helpdesk to override the port config

usage.description:
port usage name. 

If EVPN is used, use `evpn_uplink`or `evpn_downlink`

egress_port_ids.description: at least one of `ingress_port_ids`,`egress_port_ids` or `ingress_networks` should be specified

ingress_networks.description: at least one of `ingress_port_ids`,`egress_port_ids` or `ingress_networks` should be specified

ingress_port_ids.description: at least one of `ingress_port_ids`,`egress_port_ids` or `ingress_networks` should be specified

output_port_id.description: only one of of `output_port_id` or `output_network` should be specified

all_networks.description: if `mode`==`trunk`, whether to trunk all network/vlans

allow_dhcpd.description:
if DHCP snooping is enabled, whether DHCP server is allowed on the interfaces with. All the interfaces from port configs using this port usage are effected. Please notice that allow_dhcpd is a tri-state.

When it is not defined, it means using the systems default setting which depends on whether the port is a access or trunk port.

bypass_auth_when_server_down.description: if `port_auth`==`dot1x`, whether to allow the device to connect if RADIUS server is down

disable_autoneg.description: if speed and duplex are specified, whether to disable autonegotiation

duplex.description: link connection mode, choices are auto (default), full, and half

enable_mac_auth.description: if `port_auth`==`dot1x`, whether to enable MAC Auth

guest_network.description: if `port_auth`==`dot1x`, which network to put the device into if the device cannot do dot1x. default is null (i.e. not allowed)

mac_limit.description: max number of mac addresses, default is 0 for unlimited, otherwise range is 1 or higher, with upper bound constrained by platform

mtu.description: media maximum transmission unit (MTU) is the largest data unit that can be forwarded without fragmentation. The default value is 1514.

persist_mac.description: if `mode`==`access` and `port_auth`!=`dot1x`, whether the port should retain dynamically learned MAC addresses

poe_disabled.description: whether PoE capabilities are disabled for a port

port_auth.description: if dot1x is desired, set to dot1x

rejected_network.description: if `port_auth`==`dot1x`, when radius server reject / fails

speed.description: speed, default is auto to automatically negotiate speed

stp_edge.description: when enabled, the port is not expected to receive BPDU frames

voip_network.description: network/vlan for voip traffic, must also set port_network. to authenticate device, set port_auth

no_broadcast.description: whether to disable storm control on broadcast traffic

no_multicast.description: whether to disable storm control on multicast traffic

no_registered_multicast.description: whether to disable storm control on registered multicast traffic

no_unknown_unicast.description: whether to disable storm control on unknown unicast traffic

percentage.description: bandwidth-percentage, configures the storm control level as a percentage of the available bandwidth

junos_port_usages_dynamic.description: This is a special mode where the actually usage is determined by a set of rules the port will start with `access` mode and isolated depending on the rules, if resolved, the port will have the resolved usage applied.

reset_default_when.description:
Control when the DPC port should be changed to the default port usage
Configuring to none will let the DPC port keep at the current port usage.

equals_any.description: use `equals_any` to match any item in a list

enabled.description: whether to enable VRF (when supported on the device)

extra_routes.description: The property key is the destination

networks.description: The property key is the network name or a CIDR

port_config.description: The property key is the port name or range (e.g. "ge-0/0/0-10")

name.description: name that we'll use to derive config

preserve_dscp.description: whether to preserve dscp when sending traffic over VPN (SSR-only)

class_percentages.description:
percentages for differet class of traffic: high / medium / low / best-effort
sum must be equal to 100

vlan_id.description: if WAN interface is on a VLAN

class_percentage.description:
percentages for differet class of traffic: high / medium / low / best-effort
sum must be equal to 100

wan_ext_ip.description: optional, if spoke should reach this port by a different IP

wan_source_nat.description: optional, by default, source-NAT is performed on all WAN Ports using the interface-ip

netmask.description: used only if `subnet` is not specified in `networks`

network.description: optional, the network to be used for mgmt
